statement.tex:
%text Commander Spock of Star Trek fame would like to invest some money for a period of 2 \underline\text{Vulcan years} (1 Vulcan year = 2 Earth years)
He can choose one of two banks - Bank E on planet Earth or Bank V on planet Vulcan.
Bank E offers $3\%$ compound interest every \underline\text{6 Earth months} while Bank V offers $6\%$ compound interest \underline\text{once every Vulcan year}. Which bank should Spock choose to get greater returns? %
\\ %text Over a period of \underline\text{2 Vulcan years}, how many times will the money compound in the two banks (Bank E and Bank V) ? %
\\ %text Given the number of compounding periods, which bank will give the \underline\text{larger final amount} at the end of 2 Vulcan years? \textbf{Use: } $(1.03)^4 = 1.13, (1.06)^2=1.124$ %

options.tex: \begin{tabular}{|c|c|} \hline & \text{\# times money will compound} \\ \hline \text{Bank E} & 8 \\ \hline \text{Bank V} & 2 \\ \hline \end{tabular}
\begin{tabular}{|c|c|} \hline & \text{\# times money will compound} \\ \hline \text{Bank E} & 4 \\ \hline \text{Bank V} & 2 \\ \hline \end{tabular}

reason.tex:
%text \underline\text{2 Vulcan years = 4 Earth years}
As Bank E compounds money \underline\text{twice} every \underline\text{Earth year} (once every 6 Earth months), therefore over 4 Earth years, it would have compounded the money $=4\times 2 = 8$ times.
Similarly, Bank V compounds money \underline\text{once} every \underline\text{1 Vulcan year}.
Therefore, over 2 Vulcan years, it would compound the money $=2\times 1 = 2$ times. %

options.tex: %text \textbf{Bank E}. Spock should put his money with the bank on Earth. %
%text \textbf{Bank V}. Spock should put his money with the bank on Vulcan.. %

reason.tex:
%text If Spock puts in Rs. P initially (the principal), then at the \underline\text{end of 2 vulcan years}, he would get the following \underline\text{final amounts}.
%
\begin{tabular}{|c|c|c|c|} \hline & \text{Interest} & \text{Final amount} & \text{Equals} \\ \hline \text{Bank E} & 3\% & \underbrace{P\cdot\left( 1 + \frac{3}{100}\right)^8}_{(1.03)^8 = (1.03^4)^2 = (1.13)^2} & 1.28P \\ \hline \text{Bank V} & 6\% & P\cdot\left( 1+\frac{6}{100}\right)^2 & 1.124P \\ \hline \end{tabular} %text
It is obvious that Spock's money will grow more on Earth. And hence, he should invest his money with \underline\text{Bank E}. %
